2015-11-30.lead_paragraph: Years after a phone-hacking scandal exposed a pattern of illicit information-gathering, the unspoken laws of tabloids have been reconfigured.
2015-11-30.abstract: Tabloid newspapers owned by Rupert Murdoch have published far fewer racy stories in years since 2011 phone-hacking scandal exposed their reliance on illegal methods of reporting; recent exception was article in The Sun that reported on use of drugs and prostitutes by Lord Sewel.

headline.main: Murdoch’s British Tabloids Clean Up Their Acts
headline.print_headline: Getting the Scoop on the Up and Up

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Wiretapping and Other Eavesdropping Devices and Methods
